description: From French chandelle (“chandelle”). Doublet of candela and candle.

entries.meaning: An aerobatic maneuver in which a 180° turn is combined with a climb.

verbs.description: chandelle (third-person singular simple present chandelles, present participle chandelling, simple past and past participle chandelled)

entries.meaning: To perform an aerobatic maneuver in which a 180° turn is combined with a climb.
